Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: One that desires to excel should endeavor in those things that are in themselves most excellent.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Whenever you are angry, be assured that it is not only a present evil, but that you have increased a habit.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Neither should a ship rely on one small anchor, nor should life rest on a single hope.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: The essence of philosophy is that a man should so live that his happiness shall depend as little as possible on external things.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings. Then you will forget your anger.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Imagine for yourself a character, a model personality, whose example you determine to follow, in private as well as in public.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: The greater the difficulty the more glory in surmounting it. Skillful pilots gain their reputation from storms and tempests.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Neither should a ship rely on one small anchor, nor should life rest on a single hope.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: One that desires to excel should endeavor in those things that are in themselves most excellent.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Whoever does not regard what he has as most ample wealth, is unhappy, though he be master of the world.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: If evil be spoken of you and it be true, correct yourself, if it be a lie, laugh at it.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: The world turns aside to let any man pass who knows where he is going.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: It is impossible to begin to learn that which one thinks one already knows.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Silence is safer than speech.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Keep silence for the most part, and speak only when you must, and then briefly.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: Control thy passions lest they take vengeance on thee.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: If you seek truth you will not seek victory by dishonorable means, and if you find truth you will become invincible.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: If thy brother wrongs thee, remember not so much his wrong-doing, but more than ever that he is thy brother.

Quotes.Author: Epictetus
Quotes.Quote: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
